main.name: Andrew Hartness
main.bio: A Software Engineer, from Charlotte NC, with 3 years of experience outside of college.  Got my start in Quality Assurance and quickly moved into a software development career.  Have worked on projects using .NET and most recently moved into building out react web applications and have found a love for the javascript library.  As of lately, began an interest in learning react-native to build mobile application, as well as learning Next.JS & TailwindCSS.

education.school: University of North Carolina at Charlotte

work.title: Application Programmer V (Contractor)
work.description: Lead Developer for the PI-Planning component of the bank's online reporting application Agileview.  Agileview pulled data directly from the Jira RestApi to provide real-time, on demand reporting at a project, program and portfolio levels.  Saw a increase of 8000 & 1200 board creations during the year of development.  Built out two new components:  ROAM Board for tracking risks and a Team Board for tracking team progress within a Program Interval.

work.title: Software Engineer I
work.description:
Full Stack Development for AMTdirect's Lease Administration and Accounting Software.  Development on AMTdirect's new lease accounting calculator.
Wrote Date Fix Scripts & Stored Procedures (SQL) for calculations of FASB Accounting Standard.

Maintenance of legacy code and development of new functionality base of FASB/Accounting business requirements.  Worked with a team of 5 on AMTdirect's GASB Financial accounting calculator WebAPI (Lead on Front End Development with React & Typescript.  Developed Re-vamp of Journal Entry Module for the FASB Accouting standard within AMTdirect's Accounting Web Application (RESTApi, KendoUI, .NET)

work.title: QA Analyst
work.description: Manual Testing of AMTdirect Software.  Developed & Maintained automated tests (VB) for release builds.  Wrote test cases based on accounting business requirement documents that were imported into out QA and Automation software (TestComplete)
